question: A 3-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of a 5-day history of yellowing of his eyes and skin. He has had generalized fatigue and mild shortness of breath over the past 2 months. Examination shows pale conjunctivae and scleral jaundice. The spleen is palpated 4 cm below the left costal margin. Laboratory studies show a hemoglobin concentration of 8.5 g/dL and a mean corpuscular volume of 76 μm3. A peripheral blood smear shows round erythrocytes that lack central pallor. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the splenomegaly seen in this child?
